class JumpScale.grid.messagehandling.MessageHandler.MessageHandler[source]¶
connect2localLogserver(reconnect=False)[source]¶
data2Message(ttype, data)[source]¶

@param data is already compressed/serialzed data block @param ttype is 1:log, 2:signal, 3:ec, 4:alert, 5:perfinfo, 6:raw

type : 10 = uncompressed, json type : 11 = uncompressed, cpickle type : 12 = compressed, json type : 13 = compressed, cpickle

@return 4byte_sizepacket,4byte_epoch,4byte_grid_id,4byte_nodeid,4byte_pid,1byteDataType,crcOfData,data

12 = compressed & json 13 = compressed & cpickle 10 = json 11 = cpickle

read the queue and call method with as param the message @param messageType 0 means all types, 1=log,2=signal,3=error,5=stat @removeWhenDone if True then when message processed succesfully, remove from queue succesfull means method needs to return True

unPackMessage(message)[source]¶

unpack 1 message #format is 4byte_sizepacket,1byte_type,4byte_epoch,4byte_grid_id,4byte_nodeid,4byte_pid,1byteDataType,crcOfData,data @return dtype,length,epoch,gid,nid,pid,data

unPackMessageSeries(content)[source]¶

unpack text to series of messages #format is concatenation of 4byte_sizepacket,4byte_epoch,4byte_grid_id,4byte_nodeid,4byte_pid,1byteDataType,crcOfData,data @return [[dtype,length,epoch,gid,nid,pid,data]]

JumpScale.grid.messagehandling.logger_patch module¶

class JumpScale.grid.messagehandling.logger_patch.LoggerPatch[source]¶

Bases: object

This logger patch extension changes the log behaviour of Qshell. This is done by monkey patching the logger which makes it forward all logging to a message server. Note that this patch is automatically applied when the extension is loaded. However, it will not if the necessary message server isn’t available or not running.

CONFIG_PATH = '/opt/jumpscale/cfg/logger_patch.cfg'¶
DEFAULT_ADDRESS = '127.0.0.1:7777'¶
apply(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶
configure(address='127.0.0.1:7777')[source]¶
